A standard stock solution was first prepared in a 250ml glass vial by dissolving 1μl of pure phase compound in water. Dilutions were subsequently performed using 40ml glass vials in order to have 10nmol C of each compound delivered to the IRMS detector. Isotope ratios of benzene and TCE were determined using an Agilent™ 7890a gas chromatograph (GC) coupled to an Isoprime™ 100 isotope ratio mass spectrometer (IRMS) via an Isoprime GC5 combustion interface. For water samples, a preconcentration step was performed using a purge-and-trap (P&T) module (Stratum Teledyne Tekmar). Twenty-five (25) ml of the sample was purged with gas-phase N2 (40ml/min) and the degassing VOC was accumulated on a Vocarb 3000 adsorbing matrix (VICI). Following the purging step (10min), the VOC was transferred into a cryogenic trap (Tekmar Dohrmann) installed at the entry of the GC column.
